channel.title: Suggestion
channel.description:
Ok this forum is great and all but there is too much flaming and spamming going on. I've been testing mopar by posting none useful posts, no one has even warned me yet (good thing and bad). In my opinion this forum will be awesome if you are more strict. This forum is starting to die meaning spamming, flaming, non useful posts on all of the boards. Go look in general discussion, I bet every thread in that section contains at least 2 flames and spams. This is the reason Mr.Chris left, he was an awesome moderator and community member but he left because this community is falling apart. I hardly come here anymore because I have noticed it is full of spam and flaming. The only [b]useful[/b] posters I see are, All administrators, global moderators, some community members, regecks, 93dcthugs93. Thats all I can think of now. Before Silab got banned no offense but it was moderated alot often, and better. Since she has been de-modded because of the keylogger shit it has turned into one massive flamming and spamming forum. Don't get me wrong there are a few sections with [b]a lot[/b] of helpful posts. Like the Java sections, there are tons of helpful people in there, along with web design for the most part.
Just put this into consideration please?

item.title: Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Easy doesn’t mean better. I can’t stand people that don’t type out what they want to say properly. If people feel that they can rely on filtering here, they will see no need to type and spell properly should they join other communities in the future.

item.title: Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:23, topic:60867”][quote author=usernamelol link=topic=87727.msg932398#msg932398 date=1172221725]

This forum isn’t an all adult forum. There are people at the age of 12 and younger, all the way up to people in their 20s. There may even be older people.
It will never be spam free. That’s like expecting an entire group of year 7 students at a public school to have the complete and correct school uniform every single day. It’s just not going to happen.

Age does not matter. People should stop spamming and flaming they need to learn to grow up. By year 7 you should be smart enough not to flame and spam. If not you got some serious problems.
[/quote]
You need to realise that we’re not talking about a small group here. It’s a forum with 86 thousand members now, and I’d imagine that at least 10 thousand of those are active on a regular basis.
It would be an impossible task for a forum of this nature. Teachers at school would have a class of 30 students at the most, and even they manage to have trouble co-ordinating that group size. And for the most part, that’s who we’re talking about - school aged students.

How many of the 86 thousand members do you think will even see this topic and act on it?[/quote]
Yeah remember 85 thousand are 0 posters.

Read full topic

It would be an impossible task for a forum of this nature. Teachers at school would have a class of 30 students at the most, and even they manage to have trouble co-ordinating that group size. And for the most part, that’s who we’re talking about - school aged students.

How many of the 86 thousand members do you think will even see this topic and act on it?

That's like expecting an entire group of year 7 students at a public school to have the complete and correct school uniform *every* single day. It's just not going to happen.

item.title: Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Whether it’s useful is always going to be an issue. There are thousands of regulars, and all will have varying views as to what is useful and what isn’t. It’s all relative to who you are, how laid back you are, and how much you know.

For example, lets say I posted a program I made in the Java section. Mopar, k00dr, Krichevskoy and pplsuqbawlz might see it as the most useless topic out.
On the other hand, maybe it’s my first GUI program and I spent a while working on it and thought it could use some feedback.
Commenting on things like that is fine, but as I said, people should keep it constructive.
Someone saying “You suck noob” isn’t going to tell me ‘which’ part of my Java program isn’t that great. Nor will it teach me anything.
Compare that comment to this one:
“Hey Lothy - Your program is ok. But I think you could work on the GUI a bit, it looks a little messy. That, and…”
See which type of ‘comment’ is helpful?

This forum isn’t an all adult forum. There are people at the age of 12 and younger, all the way up to people in their 20s. There may even be older people.
It will never be spam free. That’s like expecting an entire group of year 7 students at a public school to have the complete and correct school uniform every single day. It’s just not going to happen.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:17, topic:60867”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=87727.msg932053#msg932053 date=1172214714]

Hey I post useful things

  • not every post is useful… I sure moparisthebest has said nice program or soemthing equivilent at least once

No one said anything about you flaming? In general the community has really became a bunch of spammers, hopefully many people will start coming around.

I try not to spam now, but my problem is that I like commenting on everything I read so my posts climb high pretty quickly.
[/quote]
Commenting on things is in no way spamming.

Posting criticism is fine, but keep it constructive, and unbiased if possible.
Posting comments is fine too, but again, keep them constructive and unbiased.

Spamming is more or less the one line dumb ass remarks that find their way into topics.
Stuff like /sarcasm, lol, wtf, and so on. They aren’t constructive, they don’t further people’s ability, and in no way to they help. They’re not even funny.

As I pointed out the other night to MybJames, I scrolled through most of his posts and they were one liners that were just flaming people. You shouldn’t join a community if you plan to be aggressive towards people. There are several of those tyrants going around the boards, and they’re the ones ultimately responsible.

Oh oops ok nvm I thought he ment everyone else posted unuseful things but I guess not. mine are neutral

yah comments are nice but they aren’t really usefull

for instence

Good idea yakman!

It’s the sixth page of the thread, but someone is finally submitting code

he is being nice and there is nothing worng but does it help? not really (not saying that it is bad or anyhting, but how is it useful?)

People aren’t going to rock up to the forums everyday and have a brand new program to post. Could you imagine how boring this place would be if there was absolutely no conversation going on?[/quote]

I didn’t say it is spamming, but is it useful? thats what it seems he wants… to me anyway[br][size=1]Posted on: February 22, 2007, 06:25:28 PM[/size][hr][quote=“lothy, post:17, topic:60867”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=87727.msg932053#msg932053 date=1172214714]

Hey I post useful things

  • not every post is useful… I sure moparisthebest has said nice program or soemthing equivilent at least once

No one said anything about you flaming? In general the community has really became a bunch of spammers, hopefully many people will start coming around.

I try not to spam now, but my problem is that I like commenting on everything I read so my posts climb high pretty quickly.
[/quote]
Commenting on things is in no way spamming.

Posting criticism is fine, but keep it constructive, and unbiased if possible.
Posting comments is fine too, but again, keep them constructive and unbiased.

Spamming is more or less the one line dumb ass remarks that find their way into topics.
Stuff like /sarcasm, lol, wtf, and so on. They aren’t constructive, they don’t further people’s ability, and in no way do they help. They’re not even funny.

As I pointed out the other night to MybJames, I scrolled through most of his posts and they were one liners that were just flaming people. You shouldn’t join a community if you plan to be aggressive towards people. There are several of those tyrants going around the boards, and they’re the ones ultimately responsible.

Oh oops ok nvm I thought he ment everyone else posted unuseful things but I guess not. mine are neutral

yah comments are nice but they aren’t really usefull

for instence

Good idea yakman!

It’s the sixth page of the thread, but someone is finally submitting code

he is being nice and there is nothing worng but does it help? not really (not saying that it is bad or anyhting, but how is it useful?)

People aren’t going to rock up to the forums everyday and have a brand new program to post. Could you imagine how boring this place would be if there was absolutely no conversation going on?[/quote]

on your second part, conversation isn’t realy a forum thing, more for irc. but w/e I don’t really care bout it, just the topic confused me.
